Why Naming Matters

11 Jan 2015

One of the more subtle lessons I’ve learned since I started developing was how much object names both guide and reveal your thought process as you are building an application. Consider a few rules of thumb:

Stick with real world objects as much as possible. Don’t be cute

class Song
  def initialize(name, artist, album, duration)
    @name     = name
    @artist   = artist
    @album    = album
    @duration = duration
  end
end

instead of:

class SongMaker
  def initialize(name, artist, album, duration)
    @name     = name
    @artist   = artist
    @album    = album
    @duration = duration
  end
end

Use is_attribute? for Booleans

user.update(is_connected?: true)

instead of:

user.update(connected: true)

Don’t include object type

class Song
  def initialize(name, artist, album, duration)
    @name     = name
    @artist   = artist
    @album    = album
    @duration = duration
  end

  def split
    # split logic
  end
end

instead of:

class Song
  def initialize(name, artist, album, duration)
    @name     = name
    @artist   = artist
    @album    = album
    @duration = duration
  end

  def split_method
    # split logic
  end
end

If you haven’t also checked out the Ruby Style Guide you should do so.
